Summary: The hotel is located in the Haidian district, away from the city center, next to a Four Points hotel and close to a large shopping mall with various dining options, including restaurants that serve dog meat. The hotel is near the last metro stop, requiring a taxi ride to reach it, and taxi drivers may not always know the location.

The Ascott Beijing is located in the CBD, near the Guo Mao subway stop, with a 7-Eleven nearby. However, the reviews mention it is not particularly suited for tourists seeking an authentic local experience and advise doing your homework to find a local guide.

The Autumn Garden Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a glimpse into traditional Beijing life with narrow alleyways and local surroundings. It is situated a 5-10 minute walk from the subway and Tiananmen Square.

The Bamboo Garden Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a stay in a traditional Chinese setting with courtyards and gardens. It is within walking distance to local restaurants, shops, and the Houhai Lake area.

Century Towers Beijing offers apartment-style rooms with full kitchens and dining areas, and is located across the street from a large supermarket. As a Chinese hotel, the price is cheaper than foreign chains, and the wait staff speaks very little English.

The hotel is located about 20-30 minutes by foot to Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. There is an older-style coffee shop with character in the lobby, and the surrounding area has a few shops and restaurants.
The Far East Hotel/Hostel is located in the Hutongs, offering a glimpse into traditional Beijing life. The hotel is situated in a neighborhood with local restaurants, shops, and markets.

The Friendship Hotel was built in the 1950s in traditional Beijing style with grey brick and Chinese roofs and is comprised of multiple buildings connected by underground walkways with gardens in the center; it is located in northwest Beijing near Peking University, Tsinghua University, Zhongguancun High Tech district, and the Summer Palace. The hotel has multiple restaurants including a TGI Friday's, as well as shops and a supermarket.
The Guangming Hotel is near a food street adjacent to the hotel and the embassy district. Breakfast at the hotel is available, but reviewers suggest exploring other local options.

The Beijing Hotel is a historic hotel consisting of three buildings, with Building B being the oldest, dating back over 100 years, and Buildings C from pre-Mao times. The older buildings feature decor reminiscent of communist China, with red drapings and golden stairways, offering a glimpse into the past.

The hotel is located next to the main railway station, which some consider an unsafe area not representative of real life or good restaurants. While centrally located, it may not be ideal for experiencing authentic local culture, but it is within walking distance of some attractions and shopping areas.

The hostel is located in a quiet alley near a bus stop, between the Forbidden City and WanfangJie walking/shopping street, and a few blocks from the Night Market. Some reviewers mention that the hostel is not a well-known hotel and can be difficult for taxi drivers to find.

Sihe Hotel is a small, traditional courtyard-style hotel located in a hutong, offering an authentic Chinese experience. It is situated in a local neighborhood, within walking distance of main attractions and the subway.

Radegast Beijing is described as a typical Chinese 5-star hotel with Chinese-speaking staff, and uniquely furnished rooms. It is located in a quieter but central neighborhood, offering a different experience from well-known international chains.

The Capital Hotel has multiple restaurants serving both Western and Chinese cuisine; and it is located near a Muslim place and a mini-market with local products. The hotel is located near hutongs, or old alleyways, but some reviewers say the area lacks character.

The China World Hotel is located in a commercial area connected to a high-end shopping mall with a subway stop, and is a short walk to the Silk Market. While the hotel offers Chinese dining options, some reviewers suggest venturing outside the hotel for a more authentic local experience and better value.

The hotel is next to local restaurants that cater to foreigners, and staff may encourage strangers to sit with you at breakfast. The hotel name in Chinese is Chung Shi Bing Guan, which local taxi drivers know.

The Commune by the Great Wall offers stays in architect-designed villas, some shared, spread across a valley, providing access to a private, unrestored section of the Great Wall. Reviews suggest the restaurants cater to Western flavors and that staff may have limited English proficiency.

Courtyard 7 is located in the hutong area near Nanluoguxiang street, offering a traditional Chinese courtyard setting. The hotel is situated in a renovated 300-year-old courtyard home with traditionally-designed furnishings.

The hotel is connected to the New World Shopping Center which includes a supermarket and food court, and is surrounded by local Chinese restaurants. Some reviewers found it lacking in authentic local experience, and more like being in America.
The hotel is located near a market where locals line up to get food, and there are also candy stalls. There are also restaurants in the area for a quick bite.

The Crowne Plaza Beijing is located on Wangfujing Street, a central shopping area, near night food markets and within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Some reviewers suggest that it is a western chain hotel and recommend trying a Chinese one for a more authentic experience.

The hotel is located near Peking and Tsinghua Universities, with modern restaurants like Bellagio, Middle 8, and Three Guizhou Men nearby, as well as Ghost Street and Huajia Yiyuan suggested by the concierge. Subway access is available to the Forbidden Palace and Tiananmen, and the Gate Mall offers reasonably priced restaurants.

This hotel is located near the airport and exhibition center, and requires a long taxi ride to central Beijing. The surrounding area is industrial, with few local amenities and limited pedestrian access.

The hotel is located a bit far from the city center, but near the Olympic Park, with small stores and restaurants nearby that close relatively early. A small mall with a food court offering affordable local food is next door.

The hotel is located near a subway station on the third ring road, but is surrounded by construction and not within walking distance of many attractions. Some reviewers mention that there are a few local restaurants within a 10-minute walk.

The hotel is located in a hutong, offering a central location near Wangfujing St. and Tiananmen Square, providing easy access to eating and tourist sites. Some reviewers suggested taking tours offered in the Forbidden City Hostel, about a 5 minute walk north of the hotel, for a good value.

The hotel is modern and does not feel Chinese, similar to a hotel in Tucson, and is located on a busy business street away from the main sites, requiring taxi rides to get around. The staff has limited English proficiency, and there are not many restaurants nearby.

The Double Happiness Courtyard Hotel is located in a traditional Hutong neighborhood, offering an authentic Chinese cultural experience. The hotel features traditional Chinese decor, courtyard settings, and is surrounded by local shops and restaurants.

The hotel is located outside the 2nd Ring Road, not close to major sites or a subway station, but near local restaurants across the street. Some reviewers mention that the location is not central, requiring taxi rides to reach attractions.
The Empark Grand Hotel is located in the northwest part of the city, a 20-30 minute taxi ride to the city center. There is an underground mall with restaurants and shops beneath the hotel.
The Fujian Hotel has a mix of Chinese and Western guests, with staff that is friendly but has limited English proficiency. The hotel's restaurant offers both Western and Chinese food.
The hotel is located near a subway station and within walking distance of shops. Some reviewers mention the opportunity to visit local areas such as the Silk Market and Hutongs.

The Grand Hotel is decorated in an old style with Chinese porcelain and rosewood furniture. Some reviewers recommend taking a rickshaw tour of the Hutongs and eating in a local house for a fantastic stay in Beijing.

The Grand Hyatt is a large, modern hotel catering to western tourists and businessmen with staff that speak fluent English, located above a mall with western-style restaurants and shops. While some reviewers found it luxurious and convenient to tourist sites, others noted that the decor is bland and sterile and does not provide an authentic Chinese experience.

The hotel is near hutongs (traditional alleyways) with local restaurants, and is close to two subway lines. Some reviewers noted that the hotel is located in Xidan, a shopping area with many malls that is not often visited by Westerners.

The hotel is located in the Central Business District outside the inner city but near a subway station, providing access to local transportation. Some reviewers suggest trying local dumpling places in the old city Hutongs (alleys) for an authentic experience, as the hotel is in the new trendy financial district where restaurants tend to be more expensive.

The Grand View Garden Hotel has a Chinese architectural style, a garden with free entry for hotel residents, and is located in a typical Beijing neighborhood with local shops and restaurants. The hotel is located far from the city center, and is frequented by more local people than foreign tourists.
The hotel is centrally located near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, with shops and restaurants nearby. The breakfast offers a mix of Chinese and Western options.

The Harmony Hotel is located near local shops and restaurants, as well as hutongs, which are traditional alleyways. Some reviewers mention trying the local food stalls and convenience stores near the hotel.

The Hebei Hotel is located in a traditional Hutong neighborhood, offering an authentic local experience of old Beijing. The hotel is within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.

The Hilton Beijing is located in a business district, away from the main shopping streets, requiring a taxi to reach the shopping malls or the nearest subway. The hotel can organize tourist trips with guides, but these tours may include visits to commercial factories or shops.

While the hotel is American style, some reviewers mention that there are some Hutongs around the hotel where it's really nice to walk and taste some more "traditional" Chinese lifestyle. However, those looking for an authentic local hotel experience should look elsewhere.

The hotel is not located in the city center but near a tree-lined neighborhood with local shops and a park; the Lido Place attached to the hotel also has restaurants geared to foreign tourists. The surrounding area has some dining and nightlife options but these seem geared to foreign tourists.

The Holiday Inn Central Plaza is located in a residential neighborhood with local restaurants and shops nearby, allowing visitors to experience the "real" Beijing. The hotel is located away from nightlife, shopping, and sightseeing areas, but there are several local restaurants within walking distance that are less touristy.

The hotel is located in a quiet residential neighborhood in western Beijing, near a subway station, with many local restaurants and shops nearby. The hotel's restaurant offers Chinese dishes, and the staff is familiar with the guests.

The hotel is not located downtown, but is close to a subway station, local restaurants, and markets, with some staff having limited English. Some reviewers mention the availability of local cuisine and nearby Chinese restaurants.

The hotel is located in a traditional Chinese area, not surrounded by tourists, near a Chinatown shopping center, and close to the Beitucheng Subway Station. There are local restaurants within walking distance.

The hotel is located in a residential area, not close to the subway, but near a hutong and local market. There are small eateries within a 7-minute walk, including the Hangzhou Eatery run by a couple from Zhejiang province specializing in dumplings and buns.

The hotel is located near the Focus Mall and across the road from the Stellar International Cineplex which has approximately 20 restaurants, a liquor store, and a department store with a supermarket. The hotel's restaurant serves Asian-style breakfast.

The Holiday Inn Temple of Heaven is located in a residential area, offering a glimpse into local Beijing life, with nearby grocery stores and local eateries. While not centrally located, it's within walking distance of the Temple of Heaven and a short taxi or subway ride to other attractions.

This hotel appears to cater primarily to locals, with limited English-speaking staff and few Westerners present. The breakfast offers a variety of options, but the same choices are available every day.

Hotel Cote Cour SL is located in a traditional Beijing hutong, offering guests a glimpse into local life. The hotel's location provides an authentic Chinese experience, and is within walking distance of the subway and shopping areas.

Hotel G is located just off a main road, providing a quiet and authentic experience away from corporate areas, though it is somewhat outside the city center. The North Chaoyang district is nearby and has restaurants for an authentic experience.

The hotel is located near the Sanyuanqiao subway station, which is also the ABC (airport Beijing city) station, providing easy access to the airport and other parts of Beijing. There are not many restaurants or shops in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, but the subway provides convenient access to other areas.

The hotel is frequented by Shanghai business people and has staff with minimal English. Some reviewers mentioned the hotel is not located near tourist attractions and the surrounding area is not suitable for quiet walks.

The New Otani Chang Fu Gong Hotel is a Japanese-owned hotel with Japanese-style elements, offering both Asian and Western breakfast options. It is centrally located near the Silk Market and a variety of restaurants, including Peking duck and hot pot.

The hotel is connected to a shopping mall with a supermarket offering local goods and restaurants that serve Chinese cuisine, and is located across from the Beijing Railway Station. Some reviewers mention the staff's limited English and the need to use Mandarin, potentially offering immersion in the local language.
The hotel is located near the Lufthansa Centre, Sanlitun bar Street, the Embassy Districts, Yashow clothing markets and is a short taxi ride to the Silk Markets. Breakfast is mainly Chinese.

The Hua Wei Business Apartment Hotel is located in a busy shopping district frequented by locals, with many local and reasonably priced restaurants nearby. It is not a touristy area and few non-Chinese people are seen in the area.

The hotel is located a bit far from the city center, about 30 minutes to downtown Wangfujing or the Temple of Heaven, but close to the Olympic Green area. The hotel restaurant offers a breakfast buffet with a wide selection of Asian foods such as dumplings and Chinese pasta.

The hotel is located in the financial district, which is not close to tourist sights, but near a subway station and a short taxi ride from the hutongs of Houhai with local bars and restaurants. Some reviewers noted difficulty communicating in English and taxi drivers not knowing the location of the hotel.

The Jade Garden Hotel has an interesting history as a guesthouse during the Long March and later became a headquarters for some Communist leaders. The hotel provides tourist maps with Chinese/English translations.
The hotel is located near local eateries, a subway station, and the Silk Market. The breakfast buffet offers a wide choice of options from Chinese to Japanese foods, including sushi and dumplings.

The Qianmen Hotel is located in a Chinese neighborhood a bit outside the tourist zone, near a local supermarket and with some non-touristy spots for dinner. The hotel has several restaurants and caters to many European travelers, offering a glimpse into a local Chinese hotel experience.

The Jinqiao Hotel Apartments is located off the beaten path, near the second ring road, and a 15Y cab ride from the train station. It is in a high-rise apartment complex where some units are rented to travelers, and there are restaurants and a small grocery store on the premises.

The Joy City Hotel is connected to the Joy City shopping mall with multiple restaurants and shops. The hotel is located close to the subway and airport bus with easy access to local currency via ATMs in the mall.

The hotel is located in the CBD area, next to the Ritz Carlton and an upscale shopping mall with world-class brands, but is not particularly close to the Forbidden City or other major tourist sites. The surrounding area does not feel very authentic or "Chinese," as many Hutongs were bulldozed to make way for upscale shopping.

The hotel is located near the Forbidden City in a tree-lined area with local eateries and shops, offering an authentic Chinese neighborhood experience. Staying here provides the opportunity to explore nearby hutongs and local hangouts.

Kelly's Courtyard is located in a hutong area, accessible by walking down three alleys, offering a quiet and cozy atmosphere with traditional decor; it is a short walk from the main street with buses and close to the Xidan shopping area.

The Kempinski Hotel Lufthansa Centre offers multiple restaurants including Dragon Palace for traditional Chinese food and Paulaner for German food and beer. It is connected to the Lufthansa Youyi Shopping City which includes a supermarket.

The Kuntai Royal Hotel is a modern hotel that is not particularly "authentic" or "Chinese." It is conveniently located near shopping, restaurants, and transportation, but may not offer a local cultural experience.

Lee Gardens Service Apartment is located in the Wanfujing area, close to shopping, markets, restaurants, and the Donganmen night food market. The hotel is within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.

The hotel is located near a shopping center and a variety of dining options, including a Peking Duck restaurant (Da Dong) located a short walk away. It is also within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.
The Loong Palace is located outside the city center, about 30-60 minutes from downtown Beijing. The hotel's restaurants offer a range of cuisines, including Chinese options at the breakfast buffet.

The Luxury Serviced Residence is located in the embassy area, near the Silk Market and a 7/11. Breakfast is provided at MCS coffee around the corner, and there are local restaurants such as De Tai Lou within walking distance.

The hotel is located a bit off the tourist track, about 15 minutes walk to the subway and a 30-minute walk to the Bird's Nest Olympic Stadium, with several good neighborhood restaurants within a 5-minute walk. The hotel's location is near the Olympic Park, which is a bit remote from the city center, but accessible by taxi or subway.
The hotel is located on the west side of the city, a bit far from the center and tourist areas, but near cheap local restaurants. Some shops and places to eat with locals are within walking distance.

The Marriott apartments are located in the Chaoyang district, slightly outside the city center, and near the Sandalwood museum. Nearby attractions include the Yashow Market and Pearl Market, accessible by taxi.
The hotel is located near the Beijing Railway Station and subway lines, offering convenient access to the city. Some reviewers mentioned that the surrounding area is crowded and may require caution.

The hotel is located away from the city center but is close to a subway station, offering convenient access to attractions. Some reviewers noted local food options nearby and that the hotel's Chinese restaurant is considered one of the best in the area.

Michael's House is located in a traditional hutong area with a courtyard and offers a local Beijing lifestyle experience. It is also conveniently located near a subway station, making it easy to access tourist attractions.

The hotel is located on Wangfujing Street, near a diverse night food market and shopping areas, and within walking distance of the Forbidden City. A DIY washer and dryer are available for a small fee.
The hotel is located in the Chaoyang District, near the Chaoyang theater, with easy subway access. Some reviewers mentioned enjoying the street food outside the hotel for a "real taste of Beijing".

The hotel is located in Beijing's west end, not close to the city center but near the Panda Zoo and Purple Bamboo Park, with a Carrefour store across the street for local shopping. Breakfast includes both Western and Asian options, and there are plenty of local restaurants around the hotel starting at Y4 for a bowl of noodles.

The Novotel Peace is close to Hutongs, but reviewers mention that the Wangfujing area is over-westernized and not too exciting, whereas the Hutong area gives a more authentic feel for Beijing. However, taxis are loathe to enter those areas (roads are very narrow), most do not know of the smaller Hutong hotels.

The hotel is near local restaurants, a food market, and a bakery, but some found the hotel itself to be an average, Western-style hotel lacking local atmosphere. It is located near the Chongwenmen subway station and within walking distance of some attractions.

Oakwood Residence is located on the Eastern 3rd ring road, about 5 minutes by foot to the subway, but not within walking distance to landmarks, shops or restaurants. Some reviews mention that most taxi drivers cannot find the place, and that directions from the concierge are useful, especially if you don't speak Chinese.
The Orange Hotel is located close to a subway station and a Wu Mart (a mini-Walmart). The hotel does not offer breakfast, but provides free bakery products, milk, and tea every night.

The hotel is located near a metro station for easy access to Beijing Central, and the rear of the hotel leads to a street with small stores and local restaurants. Some reviewers mention walking towards the Bell Tower and through the Hutong area by the lake for nightlife, bars, and restaurants.

The hotel is located in a good area with local restaurants and is close to a supermarket and subway station. The breakfast is very Chinese, though the hotel also offers Western options, and staff's English skills are limited.

The Oriental Garden Hotel is located near local restaurants where you can eat for less than Â£3 and boasts a garden complex next door which is free to hotel guests. The hotel has a unique "Old World" ambience with dark wood and staff with limited English.

The hotel is located within an upscale apartment compound, a bit far from downtown and not within walking distance to the subway. However, it has easy access to Sanlitun, CBD, and the airport via the 4th ring road, and is near Chaoyang Park.

The Park Hyatt Beijing's decor has a slight oriental touch and Sino-Japanese design influences, but reviewers note that it does not leverage the rich history of Chinese art and aesthetics. Some reviewers mention the hotel is located near subway lines, providing access to local areas, but taxi drivers often have difficulty finding the hotel.

The hotel is near a Hutong, and some reviewers recommend going to a restaurant in the hutong behind the hotel that the staff frequent. To get a local experience, it is also recommended to walk to the night market and explore side roads for small departmental stores and supermarkets.

The Peixin Hotel is owned and run by the police department, and is located about 15 minutes by taxi from the city center. The hotel is near Hongquiao market, and the front desk can write destinations in Chinese characters for guests.

The hotel is located on a ring road, a long walk from the subway, but taxis are readily available; walking 15 minutes from the hotel will lead you to a pocket of Beijing's disappearing hutongs and a local market. The hotel is located near a KFC, and opposite the hotel is a nice restaurant up a flight of stairs.

The Prime Hotel is Chinese-run and located at the quiet end of Wangfujing shopping street, near hole-in-the-wall restaurants that don't cater to tourists. Some found the hotel popular with local businessmen.

The hotel is located a short walk from the subway, which provides easy access to the city center and main sites of Beijing. There is a shopping mall with restaurants next to the hotel, and Wanda Plaza is nearby.
The hotel is located on a street full of restaurants and near two subway stations. Some reviewers noted that the breakfast buffet had a mix of Western and Chinese dishes.

Raffles Beijing is located near historic sites and shopping areas, offering a mix of Chinese and Western experiences with Chinese food sections in the breakfast and bedtime fables left on pillows. Some reviewers recommend venturing out to local cuisine and street vendor food near Wangfujing.

The hotel is located in the Chaoyang District, in Beijing's Central Business District, near a subway line, shopping mall, and the 3rd Ring Road, but is not within walking distance of tourist sights. While a new hotel, some taxi drivers may have difficulty locating it.

The hotel is located outside the main downtown area on a street with restaurants and bars frequented by locals, offering a more neighborhood setting. Staying here provides opportunities to experience Chinese culture outside of tourist areas with access to local shops and markets.

The Shangri-La Beijing is located far from the city center and tourist attractions, with limited dining and shopping options within walking distance. Some reviewers noted that the hotel caters to Westerners and lacks a distinct local character, offering a "global" feel rather than a specifically Chinese experience.

The hotel is located in the CBD and near the Silk Market, with a shopping mall attached that includes a supermarket. Some reviewers noted the hotel is not ideally located for sightseeing and that the surrounding area is under construction.

The Shatan Hotel is located on a small street in a traditional hutong neighborhood, close to local shops, markets, and restaurants. Staying at this hotel offers a glimpse into the daily life of Beijing residents and a more genuine Chinese experience.

The hotel is modern and luxurious, located in the CBD/Financial district, slightly outside the center of Beijing. Some reviewers suggest that tourists looking for a local experience may prefer a traditional courtyard hotel.

The hotel is located in a hutong near the Guloudaije subway stop on Line 2, offering access to narrow streets and old neighborhoods. It is within walking distance of the drum and bell tower, with local dumpling shops nearby.

Somerset ZhongGuanCun is located in the Haidian district, close to a subway line and Carrefour supermarket, but further from the city center and Chaoyang district. The surrounding area has convenience stores and food joints, but taxis can be difficult to catch directly from the hotel.

The Spring Garden Hotel is a traditional courtyard-style hotel located in a Hutong, offering guests a unique cultural experience. The hotel features traditional Chinese decor, cozy rooms, and is situated in a local neighborhood close to attractions.

The Sunworld Hotel (formerly Tianlun Songhe Hotel) is located just off Wangfujing Street, close to restaurants and shopping, and provides easy access to the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. There is a Chinese fast food restaurant across the street and other local dining options nearby.

The hotel is located in a semi-commercial/semi-residential area, next to an acrobat theater, with a subway entrance in front and restaurants and a Starbucks in the rear. Renovated old grain houses with restaurants are located across the street, and a clothes market is a 20-minute walk behind the hotel.

Templeside Deluxe Hutong House is located in a traditional Beijing Hutong neighborhood, offering an authentic local experience. The hotel is an old family home with a central courtyard and provides easy access to local life, with the owner speaking excellent English.

The Aman at Summer Palace is set in a historical residence with a private entrance to the Summer Palace. The property incorporates buildings that were once guesthouses for visitors to the Summer Palace during the Qing Dynasty.

The Emperor Hotel is located in a narrow lane in an old part of Beijing, tucked away in an alley street amongst the local hutongs; it is situated next to the Forbidden City in a quiet location. The hotel is within walking distance of the "back door" of the Forbidden City and the hutong area around the lakes (about a 20 - 30 minute walk).

The Opposite House is located in the Sanlitun area, near bars, restaurants, and shops that cater to European tastes, and within walking distance of the Australian embassy district. The hotel offers a Hutong Tour on Saturday mornings.

The hotel is located near a pedestrian mall and subway stop, and within walking distance of the Forbidden City. Some reviewers found it did not provide an authentic local experience, and that it felt more like a western hotel.
The Regent is near hutongs, and smaller alleyways with food stands. It is also close to the Wangfujing shopping district.

The Ritz Carlton Beijing Financial District is located in the financial district, away from many tourist spots, but near a shopping mall and Western eateries. Some reviewers note that taxi drivers may not know the location of the hotel.

The hotel is located in the Chaoyang business district next to the Shin Kong Place shopping mall, which is not conveniently situated for tourist sights but offers easy access to the subway. Some reviewers noted that the decor has a European style.

The St. Regis Beijing is located near embassies and not within walking distance of major tourist sites, but taxis are readily available. Some reviewers recommend nearby local restaurants and spas across the street.

This hotel is located in the Chaoyang district, near the Lufthansa Center and a metro stop, making it convenient to travel around Beijing. However, the hotel is described as a Western hotel with modern furnishings and may not provide an authentic local experience.

The Westin Beijing Financial Street is located in the Financial District, not near the main tourist sites, and is a 15-minute walk to the subway. Some reviewers noted western restaurants are nearby, and taxis are readily available to reach more local experiences.

The Tianlun Dynasty Hotel is located in the heart of Beijing on Wangfujing Street, near the night market, shopping district, Tiananmen Square, and Forbidden City. The hotel has an Asian-influenced style, an internal atrium with music, and offers a killer lunch buffet with Peking duck.

The hotel is located in a quiet hutong (traditional Chinese alley), offering a glimpse into local life away from the main tourist areas, yet is within walking distance of Wangfujing Street and a subway station. The surrounding hutongs feature small shops and local residents, providing an authentic Beijing experience.
The Tiantan Hotel is near the Temple of Heaven and Pearl Market, with nearby eateries for a local Chinese breakfast. The breakfast buffet at the hotel offers both Eastern and Western-style options.

Traders Hotel is located between the 3rd and 4th ring in Beijing, connected to the China World Trade building, near offices like Motorola and Hewlett Packard. It's also close to the Silk Road and Yashio markets where one can purchase local goods.

The hotel is located in the "new" business district, halfway between the Beijing airport and the city center, which is not near the subway station or tourist attractions. The location is ideal for airport access and travel around the city's perimeter.

The hotel is located close to tourist attractions, shopping, and a night market, but also "just enough away from the main tourist/travel areas that you could enjoy the local flavor there". Some reviewers mention exploring nearby hutongs and discovering local food options in the area.

Located near university sites like Tsinghua and Peking University, the hotel is situated in a non-touristy area with Korean and Japanese dining options and is frequented by international students. The surrounding neighborhood is described as a typical suburban area, considered safe during the day but potentially less so at night.

The hotel is located in a mostly residential area with many local restaurants and is a 10-minute walk from Wangfujing shopping street. It is also within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.

Xinyuan Inn offers an authentic experience, located in a modern, touristy hutong, reflecting how Chinese people stay when they travel. The hotel provides breakfast, but there is also a convenience store and a traditional Chinese breakfast restaurant nearby.

The XiXI Youyi Hotel is located a mile west of Tiananmen Square and a 10-minute walk from the Xidan subway station in one of the city's main shopping districts. The hotel is close to a supermarket and the Xidan shopping center which caters to local adults.

The Xiyuan Hotel is geared toward Chinese businessmen and located near the zoo, with restaurants and shops within walking distance. Some reviewers noted the hotel's distance from the city center and tourist attractions.

The hotel is located in Haidan (University District) near Beijing Jiatong University, with local restaurants catering to students. It is a 5-minute taxi or 7-8 minute bus ride to the XiZhiMen Underground station for commuting to central Beijing.

The Zhong An Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a glimpse into traditional Beijing living, and is within walking distance of the Beijing Railway Station. Some reviewers mention it's a Chinese hotel (not a typical Western-style tourist hotel), and the breakfast is Chinese style.
